correct_answer: Polar bears are losing sea ice in the Arctic due to warming temperatures.
retrieved_context:
relation: Habitat Loss --[Causes]-> Food Shortages--description:Habitat loss can lead to a reduction in available food sources for animals.-- relation: polar bears --[Impacted By]-> Disease Outbreaks--description:Polar bears are impacted by disease outbreaks that can thrive in warmer temperatures.-- relation: polar bears --[Affected By]-> Global Warming--description:Polar bears are affected by global warming, which causes the melting of sea ice, their primary hunting ground.-- relation: polar bears --[Vulnerable To]-> Habitat Loss--description:Polar bears are vulnerable to habitat loss due to the melting of sea ice caused by global warming.-- name: Disease Outbreaks
